props.synopsis: The Prime Minister has spoken with Donald Trump, saying an exemption for Australia from the US president's latest steel and aluminium tariffs is "under consideration". Follow live.

title.children: Trump changes tune on tariff exemption for 'very fine' Albanese

image.altText: Inside a factory where steel is being made.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said he had a "constructive and warm" conversation with Donald Trump, after the president announced 25 per cent tariffs on all steel and aluminium imports to the United States.

title.children: US tariff exemption for Australian metal exports 'under consideration'

image.altText: Men and women and a priest stand around an open coffin in a cemetery. They are surrounded by Ukrainian flags.

props.synopsis: The three-year war is in one of its most dramatic and deadly phases, as Russia desperately tries to gain territory ahead of any negotiation.

title.children: Fear that Trump's push to end Ukraine war could end up rewarding Putin

image.altText: A woman looks serious as she walks next to a taller man with a tv camera behind them pointed at her

props.synopsis: Sam Kerr's lawyer has told the court that the police never made any "meaningful" attempt to investigate claims that her client and partner were held against their will by a taxi driver.

title.children: Police response to Sam Kerr incident 'completely unacceptable', court hears

image.altText: Four Israeli military tanks patrol a road in Gaza

props.synopsis: Hamas accuses Israel of repeatedly violating the Gaza ceasefire deal over the past three weeks, saying the next release of Israeli hostages will be delayed until further notice.

title.children: Hamas delays release of more Israeli hostages until further notice

image.altText: U.S. President Donald Trump

props.synopsis: To understand how Donald Trump's Gaza plan came about, it's worth considering some comments made to a forum at one of the most prestigious US universities last year.

title.children: Trump's Gaza plan stunned the world, but he borrowed it from a relative

image.altText: A person's silhouette stands in front of a multicoloured projected graphic of a Bitcoin token.

props.synopsis: Cryptocurrencies are notoriously volatile and some economists say they have no intrinsic value, but that hasn't stopped some lenders from offering loans if Bitcoin or Ethereum are used as collateral.

title.children: Rise in crypto lending sparks financial 'contagion' concerns

image.altText: Two construction workers work on steel beams with the blue sky behind them

props.synopsis: However desperate the situation might seem, cities around the world have shown that a housing crisis can be solved quickly with sufficient political will.

title.children: Auckland's housing crisis changed quickly. Australia could do the same

image.altText: A woman wearing a dark top and sunglasses

props.synopsis: Journalist Antoinette Lattouf was taken off air part way through a fill-in presenting stint on ABC Radio Sydney  after sharing a post from Human Rights Watch about the war in Gaza in December 2023.

title.children: ABC withdraws race argument in case launched by Antoinette Lattouf

image.altText: a row of books on a shelf

props.synopsis: The lawyer for two Palestinian men arrested over books they were selling in their family store says they are being pursued for political reasons.

title.children: Israeli police seize books during raid on East Jerusalem bookshop

image.altText: A middle-aged woman with grey hair in a ponytail holding papers at a table

props.synopsis: High breast density elevates a woman's cancer risk, but unlike other countries, Australia doesn't routinely report this information.

title.children: 'Cancer might be missed': Australia lags on breast density reporting

image.altText: The Aboriginal flag flies against a blue sky.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has confirmed it has scrapped the jurisdiction's bid for a treaty with Aboriginal people, officially ending a seven-year process. Treaty advocates say the move is "saddening" and "ignorant".

title.children: 'Saddening': Treaty plans scrapped in the NT, ending seven-year process

image.altText: Nic Sandery pouring a beer from large brewery equipment.

props.synopsis: NoLo alcohol is becoming popular and may help some higher risk drinkers quit booze, according to a new study. So what's involved in making these drinks, and how healthy are they?

title.children: NoLo drinks offer a booze alternative. So, what's in them?

image.altText: Donald Trump purses his lips as he stands in front of a US flag

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says there will be "no exemptions" to his 25 per cent tariffs on steel and aluminium imports, although he is considering one for Australia.

title.children: Trump signs executive order on steel and aluminium tariffs

image.altText: Aerial picture of a coal fired power station in a regional area.

props.synopsis: WA Labor has been talking up the clean energy transition ahead of the state election. But industry experts say a lack of transmission and generation is slowing progress.

title.children: 'Magical removal of coal' in WA prompts questions over what comes next

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: There is turmoil over looming US tariffs, there is only one week until the RBA decision, and ASIC takes on Star directors in court. Watch the day unfold on the markets blog.

title.children: Tariff turmoil, one week until RBA decision, ASIC takes on Star directors in court

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: NAB survey finds business confidence increased in January, but conditions eased
Woolies kills 'WFH forever', demanding 3 days a week in the office
Blood products giant CSL squeezes 7% growth in profit

image.altText: The Star, Brisbane 2025-01-09 10:01:00

props.synopsis: Brisbane's Star casino is looking for a financial lifeline to stave off collapse but gambling reform campaigners say the Queensland government "should be ruling out" the prospect of Chow Tai Fook lifting its stake.

title.children: Government 'should be ruling out' Star casino buyout by Chow Tai Fook

image.altText: Donald Trump and Malcolm Turnbull shake hands.

props.synopsis: Former prime minister Malcolm Turnbull derides Donald Trump's mercantilist view of trade and issues a warning for Anthony Albanese that he must be strong.

title.children: 'Economic nonsense': Turnbull skewers Trump's views on trade

image.altText: Dr Brian Morton GP is seen in his clinicdoing vaccination prep .Set up pics as an example of what will happen when vaccinations start at your local GP’S Clinic. Sydney. February 24  2021. (Image_Brendan Esposito)  - Dr Brian Morton GP

props.synopsis: New bulk-billing data shows a slight improvement to 77.5 per cent of GP visits being bulk-billed. The Royal Australian College of GPs says it has a plan to restore that rate to pre-COVID levels.

title.children: Doctors pitch plan to lift bulk-billing rate to 85 per cent

image.altText: Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes looks worries during Super Bowl LIX.

props.synopsis: Patrick Mahomes's Super Bowl heroics had him in the GOAT conversation last year, but the sentiments were far less flattering after the Chiefs' thumping loss to Philadelphia.

title.children: 'I let y'all down': Mahomes vows to come back better after horror Super Bowl

image.altText: A woman next to a tent

props.synopsis: City of Moreton Bay Acting Mayor Jodie Shipway says a public health review identified human waste, toilet paper, used syringes, and vermin at the site.

title.children: Council evicts homeless campers due to public health concerns

image.altText: A man waves to children atop a ute loaded with matresses and other belongings driving on a dirt road

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says Palestinians in Gaza would not have a right to return under his plan for US "ownership" of the war-torn territory.

title.children: Trump says relocated Palestinians would have no right of return to Gaza

image.altText: An aerial shot of a flooded town.

props.synopsis: There is a risk of more flooding in the state's already saturated north, but a vital supply route has reopened.

title.children: More rain on the way, but crucial bridge reopens in North Queensland

image.altText: Wide of a sign reading: Are you cyclone prepared

props.synopsis: A cyclone advice alert has been issued in parts of WA's north in preparation for strong winds and heavy rain as a tropical low approaches the coast, expected to intensify into a cyclone as early as Wednesday.

title.children: Residents told to monitor conditions as tropical low approaches WA coast

image.altText: A woman with dark brown hair and glasses in a green coat, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: It's one of the most controversial books published this century. Author Nikki Gemmell reveals the story behind her bestseller, The Bride Stripped Bare.

title.children: 'I lost a lot of cred': Nikki Gemmell on The Bride Stripped Bare scandal

image.altText: A group watch on as two women do a role-play tugging an arm.

props.synopsis: The US foreign aid freeze could lead to more people being trafficked into online fraud compounds in Asia and more Americans and Australians being scammed, experts say.

title.children: 'A win for traffickers' as US freezes anti-crime funds

props.synopsis: Brain scans shows patients with myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS) share similar issues in a part of the brain known as the hippocampus.

title.children: Long COVID patients show brain swelling linked to memory problems, study finds

image.altText: Mapi Leon playing for Barcelona in Liga F match.

props.synopsis: Spanish football club Espanyol calls for action against Barcelona's Mapi León after she is accused of inappropriately touching opponent Daniela Caracas during a Liga F match.

title.children: Barcelona Liga F player accused of violating opponent's 'intimacy'

image.altText: A bouncer standing next to an ID scanner takes ID off patron.

props.synopsis: Privacy advocates and cybersecurity experts say the growing use of ID scanning at venues raises the risk of personal data breaches. They argue a more ambitious overhaul of privacy laws is needed.

title.children: A photo of your passport, face, and a biometric match — all to get a drink

image.altText: A tall woman pictured in a black fitted outfit in a well lit, pink hued room.

props.synopsis: It isn't always straightforward, but experts say there are things you can do to help bring purpose to your personal life.

title.children: The importance of finding meaning in life beyond work

image.altText: Protesters outside the North Sydney Council meeting where a decision on a rate increase will be voted on by councillors

props.synopsis: The packed gallery inside the council chambers erupted in boos and jeers as the special rate variation was passed by councillors late on Monday night.

title.children: North Sydney locals anger over 87 per cent rate hike 'tip of the iceberg'

image.altText: A older man stands outside a home has under a sky filled with yellow smoke.

props.synopsis: Police in Esperance are offering a $25,000 reward and seeking information from the public as investigations continue into several suspicious fires lit near homes.

title.children: Country WA town angered by 'despicable' suspected arsonist

image.altText: Three Caritas volunteers in red jumpers and blue facemasks prepare food in a kitchen.

props.synopsis: "The ruthless and chaotic way this callous decision is being implemented threatens the lives and dignity of millions," Caritas Internationalis said in a statement.

title.children: Trump's foreign aid cuts 'catastrophic', says Catholic church's charity arm

image.altText: A man with blue scrubs holding a blood pressure band

props.synopsis: Former Flinders Medical Centre nurse Geoffrey Leonard Atkins "lost his temper" and retaliated against a "highly vulnerable" patient who had thrown his head back into his face. A tribunal judgement banning the nurse from providing any health service, reveals the physically infirm patient was also ''hip-tossed'' into hospital bed railings.

title.children: 'No clinical or justifiable purpose': Nurse banned over patient headlock
